definition: to render meritorious service/to make worthy contributions/to distinguish oneself
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

sentences.english: The police strikes the job committing a crime , is investigating crimes in fact.
sentences.chinese: 差人衝擊立功地工作，其實就是偵查工作。

sentences.english: He was made a duke for his contribution in fighting against the Huns.
sentences.chinese: 在抗擊匈奴的戰爭中立功，他被授予王爺的位號。

sentences.english: Police searched everyone present at the scene of crime.
sentences.chinese: 警員搜尋了在立功現場的每一團體。

sentences.english: He repeatedly distinguished himself in the troops.
Helpful meritorious performance is a typical meritorious form of alienation.
sentences.chinese: 幫助立功是典型立功的異化形態。

sentences.english: Helpful meritorious performance is a typical meritorious form of alienation.
sentences.chinese: 幫助立功是典型立功的異化形態。

sentences.english: The horse three kneel on the ground, he daizuiligong to kill Huo Yuanjia et al.
sentences.chinese: 馬三跪在地上求饒，他要戴罪立功殺了霍元甲等人。

sentences.english: B. Former inmates are no more likely to commit crimes than are members of the general population.
sentences.chinese: 當局沒有四須䰾以前更容易立功比普通人羣的。

sentences.english: Helpful meritorious should be recognized to a certain extent.
sentences.chinese: 司法實踐應當有限度地承認幫助立功。

sentences.english: Any criminal who performs major meritorious services may be given a mitigated punishment or be exempted from punishment.
sentences.chinese: 有重大立功表現的，可以減輕或者免除處罰。

sentences.english: Those who perform deeds of merit will be rewarded.

definition: to atone for one's crimes by meritorious acts
to request recognition for sb's merits/to recommend sb for promotion or an award
to report a heroic deed/to mention sb in dispatches
see 將功贖罪|将功赎罪[jiang1 gong1 shu2 zui4]
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to display utter loyalty/to be loyal to the end
to enlist/to serve in the army
